text: aldu has always been a very early
adopter of multi slash omnichannel so
because we are in a business that has a
lot of product lots of skus lots of
colors lots of sizes for us it made a
lot of sense to go digital very hard and
very fast we decided to ship all of our
econ business from store inventory which
brought that complexity to all other
level which led to the reason why we
needed something extremely flexible
because their store inventory is never
accurate you don't want to disappoint
customer so you really need a lot of
mechanism and a lot of logic to make
sure that you're exposing as much
inventory as you can without over
promising and causing cancellation and
consumer frustrations so an order
management system solves two problems
one is inventory accuracy before the buy
button ingesting inventory from all your
different systems so you can get an
accurate view of all your inventory and
the second part is once an order has
been placed what's the best most
profitable way to fulfill that order and
to adjust that much inventory data at
scale we've actually been working really
really close with AWS tapping into some
new services to be able to process that
data faster and more accurately it's
becoming a lot easier for me to manage
my inventory in my OMS right now because
I know I'm always going to re-sing with
my Erp and I'll not have to duplicate
all the use cases that my Erp is
supposed to handle and we love customers
like Elder who really take full
advantage of the flexibility of the
platform because they're pushing the
boundaries with the customer experience
and that's what this is all about
[Music]
